intro: Timonius ponapensis, commonly known as the Ponape timonius, is a rare flowering plant native to the Pacific island of Pohnpei. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palm-like appearance with a single trunk and broad, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Timonius ponapensis is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human activity.
